pr_title: Warn about nullness annotations on outer class scoping constructs

timeline.message: Test case for warnings about scoping constructs
A tutorial is out of date
Issue warnings about nullness annotations on scoping constructs

timeline.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText: This should be getExplicitAnnotatonTrees.   Also, typeTree can't be any type tree.  For example, ArrayTrees can't be passed.  The documentation should be explicit about what trees may be passed. (And/or maybe just make it a private method in the class that uses it. Since it doesn't take all TypeTrees, I'm not sure it is of general use.)
timeline.author: smillst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1541,4 +1540,68 @@ public static boolean isWideningBinary(BinaryTree node) {
                 return false;
         }
     }
+
+    /**
+     * Returns the annotations explicitly written on the given type.
+     *
+     * @param declAnnos a list of annotations on a variable/method declaration; null if this type is
+     *     not from such a location
+     * @param typeTree the type whose annotations to return
+     * @return the annotations explicitly written on the given type.
+     */
+    public static List<? extends AnnotationTree> getExplicitAnnotations(

timeline.bodyText: Why not just make this a void method?
timeline.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText: These aren't declaration annotations; they are the annotation trees stored as modifiers of a variable.
timeline.author: smillst

replies.bodyText:
Can you be explicit about what change you are suggesting?  I can't tell from your comment.
I agree they are not declaration annotations; they are annotations stored in the declaration location.  I used declAnnos for that concept.  Are you asking for a different variable name, and if so what name do you suggest?
I don't agree with your suggestion to change "variable declaration" to "variable".  Strictly speaking, they are not stored as modifiers of a variable, but as modifiers of a variable declaration (which is represented as a VariableTree).
replies.author: mernst

replies.bodyText: When I see declAnnos, I think thats a collection/set of AnnotationMirrors that are declaration annotations, as in annotation without @Target(ElementType.TYPE_USE).  I would change declAnnos to annoTrees.  Also, the annotations could be declarations annotations or type annotations, so I would change the user-written type annotations to just the user-written annotations.
replies.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText: The Javadoc here should mention #visitAnnotatedType(List<? extends AnnotationTree>, Tree, Tree).
timeline.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand why ArrayTypes are treated differently.
timeline.author: smillst
smillst

timeline.bodyText: There is currently no error on this line.  Should there be?
timeline.author: smillst

timeline.message: Start to address code review feedback

timeline.bodyText: I would also change declAnnos to annoTree here, too.
timeline.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText:
Checks an annotated type.

Is it all annotated types, or could we still be missing some?  It's fine if you aren't confident, I'm just curious.
timeline.author: smillst

replies.bodyText: I'm pretty sure it is invoked for all annotated types.
replies.author: mernst
